node.title: Focus on Politics: Collins, National's nuclear option, self destructs
node.description: Podcast - This week, Deputy Political Editor Craig McCulloch recounts the nuclear destruction of Judith Collins' leadership and assesses the fallout. Audio
node.content:
["In July 2020, at what seemed like National's nadir, Judith Collins took the helm and promised to rebuild the party. She was - somewhat presciently - described as the nuclear option.\u00a0", "This week, she leaves the job with the party in ruins, turfed out by a shell-shocked caucus after her ham-fisted attempt to take out a rival.\u00a0", "", "
\nPhoto: RNZ / Vinay Ranchhod\n
", "The unravelling began Wednesday - about 9.30pm - when an email dropped in reporters' inboxes.\u00a0", "The press release titled\u00a0\"Simon Bridges demoted following complaint\"\u00a0referenced \"serious misconduct\" and said Collins had been left with no option.", "It caught the media and MPs off guard, and the timing and process led them to believe more was at play.\u00a0", "Bridges later explained he had been at a caucus function at Wellington's Premier House\u00a0in early 2016 with MPs including Jacqui Dean, and made an off-colour comment about the best way to conceive\u00a0a daughter.", "Dean took offence and complained;\u00a0Bridges was spoken to and apologised;\u00a0all of it dealt with five years ago.\u00a0", "Collins' actions then seem\u00a0a rash overreaction, an attempt to take out a former leader widely known to be\u00a0plotting a comeback;\u00a0a\u00a0bombshell demotion that began to look to the caucus less like appropriate discipline and more like a hit job.\u00a0", "Read more:\u00a0", "The following morning, as MPs returned to Parliament,\u00a0Bridges called it desperate. Fellow National MP and brother-in-law Simon O'Connor also did not mince his words.\u00a0", "\"I cannot work with Judith Collins as leader and I'm handing over all my portfolios this morning. I cannot and will not work with her ... there are times when the party and its values need to come to the fore and one of the reasons this party is struggling is leadership has stepped away from those values.\"\u00a0", "Just over three hours later, Judith Collins had been voted out of the leadership,\u00a0", "She fired off a goodbye tweet, and endeavoured to paint her actions as ones of principle, saying\u00a0she felt she had to act - even knowing it would likely prompt the end of her leadership.\u00a0", "But Dean has since revealed - in an interview with the Otago Daily Times -\u00a0she was surprised and disappointed her conversation with Collins weeks before\u00a0had prompted Bridges' demotion.", "There are other discrepancies with Collins' account too. Her initial claims to have the full backing of the party's board disputed by the board's president.\u00a0", "Her removal leaves National rudderless, with her deputy Shane Reti left holding the tiller as interim leader. The question now -\u00a0who the next leader will be - to be answered at the next caucus meeting on Tuesday.\u00a0", "Likely contenders include\u00a0fresh-faced MP and former Air New Zealand boss Christopher Luxon,\u00a0and Bridges himself, who RNZ understands\u00a0intends to put himself forward.\u00a0", "It was not long ago Bridges was considered the frontrunner for any leadership change, but that's now less certain.\u00a0", "For now, the caucus remains riven with factions -\u00a0full of grudges and grievances - and\u00a0Collins is still in the caucus.\u00a0She was called the nuclear option - the next leader will have to find a way to defuse her.\u00a0", "Listen free to\u00a0Focus on Politics\u00a0on\u00a0Apple Podcasts, on\u00a0\u00a0Spotify, on\u00a0iHeart Radio\u00a0or wherever you get your podcasts.\u00a0"]
